channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15952] Bulk load data replication is not working when RS user does not have permission on hfile-refs node
item.description: In our recent testing in secure cluster we found that when a RS user does not have permission on hfile-refs znode then RS was failing to replicate the bulk loaded data as the hfile-refs znode is created by hbase client and RS user may not have permission to it.
item.summary: Bulk load data replication is not working when RS user does not have permission on hfile-refs node

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: The node is created by the bulk loading client app?

No, talking about peer node which is created in hfile-refs znode. This node is created by hbase client which does add peer. I have the patch which follows the same logic as peer node which is created in rs znode. I will upload it by Monday.

This seems a general problem with how the client manipulates state directly in ZK for replication configuration. Whenever the admin client has a different principal than the HBase service account this can be a problem. Your patch will address all of the possible cases Ashish Singhi?

Thanks for the comment Andrew Purtell. We did not find any other possible cases in our internal testing which will cause this problem. The other znode which directly client creates it zookeeper.znode.replication.peers, which is anyways created/deleted by client only, so no issues here.

Attached patch which adds hfile references same as wal log nodes is added in ZK.
Patch is verified manually in our internal test clusters.
Please review.

lgtm - pending QA run.

Should the following be logged at DEBUG level ?


509	      if (ZKUtil.checkExists(this.zookeeper, peerZnode) == -1) {

510	        LOG.info("Peer " + peerZnode + " not found in hfile reference queue.");

-1 overall
